column4: another quesiont, I removed a lot of packages from a ubuntu installation, as I intend to use it as server. Now it has problems: when I insert a usb hard disk,  the disk appears in nautilus, but is NOT mounted, and I cannot mount it in nautius (no folder appear under /media)
what package do I need to let ubuntu automatically mount external disks?
I don't think I need to modify fstab
no I didn't I just removed a *LOT* of packages
desktop is still there I can use vnc to login
you removed a lot of packages /on purpose/?
are you still running gnome?  I'm pretty sure gnome-volume-manager is responsible
e.g. mono, open office, alsa, bluz etc
I will verify if the volume manager is still there or not. It's in office. thanks!
